title: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
OB: The current implementation of BidiUtil in the win32 platform uses Class.forName() to load the BidiUtil class.
EB: The BidiUtil class in the win32 platform should be loaded using the following line of code: static Callback callback = new Callback(new BidiUtil().getClass(), "windowProc", 4); This new implementation should provide the same functionality as the current implementation.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Inspect the current implementation of BidiUtil in the win32 platform.
2. Locate the line of code that uses Class.forName() for loading the BidiUtil class.
3. Replace the line of code with the suggested code: static Callback callback = new Callback(new BidiUtil().getClass(), "windowProc", 4).
4. Test the application to verify if the issue is resolved and if the functionality remains the same.
